translated: (The method of exposition in the Paṭṭhāna is as follows:

analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The three Triads and the three Duka-s are to be taken in order.🔽From an indeterminate, impingent state arises a wholesome, impingent state by way of root-cause condition.🔽From an indeterminate, impingent state arises an unwholesome, impingent state by way of root-cause condition.

original: Abyākataṁ sappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Abyākataṁ sappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Abyākataṁ sappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasappaṭigho ca naakusalo nasappaṭigho
analyzed: abyākatam sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  abyākatam sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  abyākatam sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sappaṭighaḥ ca na akusalaḥ na sappaṭighaḥ
translated: From an indeterminate, impingent state arise a wholesome, impingent state and an unwholesome, impingent state by way of root-cause condition.🔽In the section on root-cause there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on absence of object there are fifteen triplets and fifteen duals. … In the section on result there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on absence of conflict there are fifteen triplets and fifteen duals.

original: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Kusalaṁ appaṭighena tīṇi. Akusalaṁ appaṭighena tīṇi. Abyākataṁ appaṭighena tīṇi.🔽Kusalaṁ appaṭighañca abyākataṁ appaṭighañca tīṇi. Akusalaṁ appaṭighañca abyākataṁ
analyzed: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  kusalam appaṭighena tīṇi akusalam appaṭighena tīṇi abyākatam appaṭighena tīṇi  kusalam appaṭigham ca abyākatam appaṭigham ca tīṇi akusalam appaṭigham ca abyākata
translated: From a wholesome, impingent state arise three states: a wholesome, impingent state, an unwholesome, impingent state, and an indeterminate, impingent state. From an unwholesome, impingent state arise three states: an unwholesome, impingent state, a wholesome, impingent state, and an indeterminate, impingent state. From an indeterminate, impingent state arise three states: an indeterminate, impingent state, a wholesome, impingent state, and an unwholesome, impingent state.🔽From a wholesome, impingent state and an indeterminate, impingent state arise three states: a wholesome, impingent state, an unwholesome, impingent state, and an indeterminate, impingent state. From an unwholesome, impingent state and an indeterminate, impingent state arise three states: an unwholesome, impingent state, a wholesome, impingent state, and an indeterminate, impingent state.

original: appaṭighañca tīṇi. Hetuyā pannarasa …pe… aññamaññe tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate pannarasa.
analyzed: appaṭighañca tīṇi hetuyā pannarasa pe aññamaññe tīṇi pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate pannarasa
translated: In the section on root-cause there are fifteen triplets and fifteen duals. … In the section on prenascence there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on conascence there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on presence there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on absence of object there are fifteen triplets and fifteen duals. … In the section on non-disappearance there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on result
